description: HHINC reports the total income of the respondent's household.

name: CPI conversion factor - current year
description: CPI2009C provides the CPI-U multiplier (available from the Bureau of Labor Statistics) to convert dollar figures to constant 2009 dollars for variables whose reference year is the survey year (SALARY). Multiplying dollar amounts by this variable (which is constant within years) will render them comparable across time and thus suitable for multivariate analysis. For variables that have a reference year of the previous year (EARN and HHINC), users should use CPI2009P to convert dollar figures to constant 2009 dollars.For more information on how to use CPI2009C and CPI2009P, please see the SESTAT inflation adjustment page.

name: CPI conversion factor - previous year
description: CPI2009P provides the CPI-U multiplier (available from the Bureau of Labor Statistics) to convert dollar figures to constant 2009 dollars for variables whose reference year is the previous year (EARN and HHINC). Multiplying dollar amounts by this variable (which is constant within years) will render them comparable across time and thus suitable for multivariate analysis. For variables that have a reference year of the survey year (SALARY), users should use CPI2009C to convert dollar figures to constant 2009 dollars.For more information on how to use CPI2009P and CPI2009C, please see the SESTAT inflation adjustment page.

name: Alternative work arrangement
description: ALTANY indicates whether or not the respondent has an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week.  This variable has a value of yes if the respondent reported having a type of relationship with his/her principal employer such as being self-employed, job-sharing, working from home, etc.  Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTELSE, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTHOME, ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEAS, ALTSEC, ALTSELF, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

name: Main reason for alternative work arrangement
description: ALTPRI gives the respondent's reported primary reason for a temporary or alternative work arrangement.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTHOME,  ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTSEAS, ALTSELF, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

name: Second most important reason for alternative work arrangement
description: ALTSEC gives the respondent's reported second most important reason for a temporary or alternative work arrangement.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTHOME,  ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTSEAS, ALTSELF, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

name: Reason for alternative work arrangement: own boss
description: ALTBOSS indicates if a respondent reported that he/she chose to have an alternative work arrangement because he/she enjoyed being their own boss, that is, that the respondent is self-employed.  Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTOTHR, ALTPAY, ALTSTAT, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

name: Reason for alternative work arrangement: gain experience
description: ALTEXP indicates that the respondent chose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week in order to gain experience that might lead to a permanent job.  Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTOTHR, ALTPAY, ALTSTAT, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

name: Reason for alternative work arrangement: family-related reasons
description: ALTFAM indicates that the respondent chose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week because of family-related reasons.  Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFLEX, ALTOTHR, ALTPAY, ALTSTAT, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

name: Reason for alternative work arrangement: schedule flexibility
description: ALTFLEX indicates that the respondent chose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week to have schedule flexibility.  Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTOTHR, ALTPAY, ALTSTAT, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

name: Reason for alternative work arrangement: other
description: ALTOTHR indicates that the respondent chose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week for some reason other than the reasons listed.  Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTPAY, ALTSTAT, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

name: Reason for alternative work arrangement: better pay
description: ALTPAY indicates that the respondent chose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week for better pay.  Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTOTHR, ALTSTAT, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

name: Reason for alternative work arrangement: status changed to temporary
description: ALTSTAT indicates that the respondent had an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week because the principal employer changed the respondent's status to temporary.  Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTOTHR, ALTPAY, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

name: Reason for alternative work arrangement: school or training program
description: ALTTRAIN indicates that the respondent had an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week because respondent was in school or some type of training program.  Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTOTHR, ALTPAY, ALTSTAT, and ALTTYPE.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

name: Reason for alternative work arrangement: only type of work I could find
description: ALTTYPE indicates that the respondent had an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week because it was the only type of work the respondent could find.  Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTOTHR, ALTPAY, ALTSTAT, and ALTTRAIN.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

name: Relationship with principal employer: work from home
description: ALTHOME indicates that a respondent works from home for half or more of his/her work time for an alternative or temporary work arrangement.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEAS, ALTSEC, ALTSELF, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

name: Relationship with principal employer: work contracted out by employer
description: ALTOUT indicates that a respondent's primary employer contracted out his/her services to other organizations, which is considered an alternative or temporary work arrangement.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTOTHR, ALTHOME, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEAS, ALTSEC, ALTSELF, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

name: Relationship with principal employer: other
description: ALTELSE indicates that a respondent reported having an alternative or temporary work arrangement other than the options listed on the survey. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTHOME, ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEAS, ALTSEC, ALTSELF, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

name: Relationship with principal employer: short term
description: ALTSEAS indicates that a respondent works on a seasonal or short term basis.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTHOME,  ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEC, ALTSELF, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

name: Relationship with principal employer: self-employed
description: ALTSELF indicates that a respondent is self-employed, which is considered an alternative work arrangement.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTHOME,  ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEC, ALTSEAS, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

name: Relationship with principal employer: job sharing
description: ALTSHARE indicates that a respondent does job-sharing, which is considered an alternative work arrangement.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTHOME,  ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEC, ALTSEAS, ALTSELF, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

name: Relationship with principal employer: temp/employment agency
description: ALTTEMP indicates that a respondent was working through a temporary help or employment agency during the reference week, which is considered an alternative work arrangement.  The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTHOME,  ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEC, ALTSEAS, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTSELF, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

name: Area or tech used during typical week: advanced materials
description: AREAAM95 reports whether or not the respondent, who works in research, development, and/or design, worked with advanced materials in a typical week.Users should note that the universe described by the original documentation does not exactly fit the number of logical skip cases for this variable.

name: Area or tech used during typical week: biotech
description: AREAB95 reports whether or not the respondent, who works in research, development, and/or design, worked with biotechnology in a typical week.Users should note that the universe described by the original documentation does not exactly fit the number of logical skip cases for this variable.

name: Area or tech used during typical week: high performance computing
description: AREAHC95 reports whether or not the respondent, who works in research, development, and/or design, worked with high-performance computers in a typical week.Users should note that the universe described by the original documentation does not exactly fit the number of logical skip cases for this variable.

name: Area or tech used during typical week: semiconductor devices
description: AREAMS95 reports whether or not the respondent, who works in research, development, and/or design, worked with semiconductor devices in a typical week.Users should note that the universe described by the original documentation does not exactly fit the number of logical skip cases for this variable.

name: Area or tech used during typical week: flexible manufacturing, robotics
description: AREAR95 reports whether or not the respondent, who works in research, development, and/or design, worked with flexible manufacturing or robotics in a typical week.Users should note that the universe described by the original documentation does not exactly fit the number of logical skip cases for this variable.

name: Area or tech used during typical week: software producibility
description: AREASF95 reports whether or not the respondent, who works in research, development, and/or design, worked with software producibility in a typical week.Users should note that the universe described by the original documentation does not exactly fit the number of logical skip cases for this variable.

name: Area or tech used during typical week: sensor and signal processing
description: AREASP95 reports whether or not the respondent, who works in research, development, and/or design, worked with sensor or signal processing in a typical week.Users should note that the universe described by the original documentation does not exactly fit the number of logical skip cases for this variable.

name: Energy-related activity most involved in work
description: If a respondent reported to spending most of his/her work hours in energy or fuel, ENACT specifies the energy-related activity that the respondent performs.

name: Energy source involved most
description: If a respondent reported to spending most of his/her work hours in energy or fuel, ENSRC specifies which type of energy the respondent works with.

name: Most important reason for working outside field of highest degree
description: NRREA reports the most important reason that the respondent was working in a field unrelated to the field of his/her highest degree. The variable NRSEC reports the second most important reason that the respondent was working in a field unrelated to the field of his/her highest degree.

name: Second most important reason for working outside field of highest degree
description: NRSEC reports the second most important reason that the respondent was working in a field unrelated to the field of his/her highest degree. The variable NRREA reports the most important reason that the respondent was working in a field unrelated to the field of his/her highest degree.

name: Reason for working outside field of highest degree: career change
description: NRCHG indicates whether or not the career change was one reason that the respondent was working in a field unrelated to the field of his/her highest degree. Other variables from this survey question include NRCON, NRFAM, NRLOC, NROCNA, NRPAY and NROT.

name: Reason for working outside field of highest degree: working conditions
description: NRCON indicates whether or not working conditions were a reason that the respondent was working in a field unrelated to the field of his/her highest degree. Other variables from this survey question include NRCHG, NRFAM, NRLOC, NROCNA, NRPAY and NROT.

name: Reason for working outside field of highest degree: family-related reasons
description: NRFAM indicates whether or not family was one reason for working outside field of the respondent's highest degree. Other variables from this survey question include NRCHG, NRCON, NRLOC, NROCNA, NRPAY and NROT.

name: Reason for working outside field of highest degree: job location
description: NRLOC indicates whether or not job location was one reason for working outside field of the respondent's highest degree. Other variables from this survey question include NRCHG, NRCON, NRFAM, NROCNA, NRPAY and NROT.

name: Reason for working outside field of highest degree: suitable job not available
description: NROCNA indicates whether or not the fact that no suitable job available was one reason for working outside field of the respondent's highest degree. Other variables from this survey question include NRCHG, NRCON, NRFAM, NRLOC, NRPAY and NROT.

name: Reason for working outside field of highest degree: Other
description: NROT indicates whether or not other reason was one reason for working outside field of the respondent's highest degree. Other variables from this survey question include NRCHG, NRCON, NRFAM, NRLOC, NRPAY and NROCNA.

name: Reason for working outside field of highest degree: pay/promotion
description: NRPAY indicates whether or not pay or promotion was one reason for working outside field of the respondent's highest degree. Other variables from this survey question include NRCHG, NRCON, NRFAM, NRLOC, NROCNA and NROT.

name: Job satisfaction
description: JOBSATIS reports how satisfied the respondent is with his/her current job.

name: Satisfaction principal job's opportunities for advancement
description: SATADV indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's advancement opportunities.  SATADV is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job.  The other variables include SATBEN, SATCHAL, SATIND, SATLOC, SATRESP, SATSAL, SATSEC, and SATSOC.

name: Satisfaction principal job benefits
description: SATBEN indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's benefits.  SATBEN is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job.  The other variables include SATADV, SATCHAL, SATIND, SATLOC, SATRESP, SATSAL, SATSEC, and SATSOC.

name: Satisfaction principal job's intellectual challenge
description: SATCHAL indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's intellectual challenge.  SATCHAL is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job.  The other variables include SATADV, SATBEN, SATIND, SATLOC, SATRESP, SATSAL, SATSEC, and SATSOC.

name: Satisfaction principal job's degree of independence
description: SATIND indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's degree of independence.  SATIND is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job.  The other variables include SATADV, SATBEN, SATCHAL, SATLOC, SATRESP, SATSAL, SATSEC, and SATSOC.

name: Satisfaction principal job's job location
description: SATLOC indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's location.  SATLOC is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job.  The other variables include SATADV, SATBEN, SATCHAL, SATIND, SATRESP, SATSAL, SATSEC, and SATSOC.

name: Satisfaction principal job's level of responsibility
description: SATRESP indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's level of responsibility.  SATRESP is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job.  The other variables include SATADV, SATBEN, SATCHAL, SATIND, SATLOC, SATSAL, SATSEC, and SATSOC.

name: Satisfaction principal job salary
description: SATSAL indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's salary.  SATSAL is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job.  The other variables include SATADV, SATBEN, SATCHAL, SATIND, SATLOC, SATRESP, SATSEC, and SATSOC.

name: Satisfaction principal job's job security
description: SATSOC indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's contribution to society.  SATSOC is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job.  The other variables include SATADV, SATBEN, SATCHAL, SATIND, SATLOC, SATRESP, SATSAL, and SATSEC.

name: Satisfaction principal job's contribution to society
description: SATSOC indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with the contribution to society of his/her principal job.  SATSOC is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job.  The other variables include SATADV, SATBEN, SATCHAL, SATIND, SATLOC, SATRESP, SATSAL, and SATSEC.

name: Attended work-related training
description: WKTRNI indicates whether or not the respondent had attended a work-related training, workshop, or seminar within the last twelve months, not including college coursework towards a degree program.

name: Most important reason for taking work-related training
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTREASN reports the respondent's most important reason for attending the training.

name: Reason for attending training: increase advancement opportunities
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTRADV indicates whether or not the respondent's reason for attending the training was to increase advancement opportunities. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTROT, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

name: Reason for attending training: facilitate occupation change
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTRCHG indicates whether or not the respondent's reason for attending the training was to facilitate an occupation change. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTROT, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

name: Reason for attending training: facilitate occupation change to different field
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTRCHOC indicates whether or not the respondent's reason for attending the training was to facilitate an occupation change in a different field. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTROT, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

name: Reason for attending training: required/expected by employer
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTREM indicates whether or not the respondent attended the training because it was expected or required from an employer. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHG, WTRCHOC, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTROT, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

name: Reason for attending training: licensure/certification
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTRLIC indicates whether or not the respondent attended the training in order to become licensed or certified in a particular skill. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHG, WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTROT, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

name: Reason for attending training: learn skills for recently acquired position
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTRNEW indicates whether or not the respondent attended the training in order to gain skills or knowledge for a recently acquired job. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHG, WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTROPPS, WTROT, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

name: Reason for attending training: increase advancement opportunities in current occupation
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTROPPS indicates whether or not the respondent attended the training in order to increase opportunities for advancement in the respondent's current position. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHG, WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROT, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

name: Reason for attending training: other
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTROT indicates whether the respondent had attended the training for a reason other than the options listed in the questionnaire.  Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHG, WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

name: Reason for attending training: leisure/personal interest
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTRPERS indicates whether the respondent had attended the training for personal interest or leisure.  Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHG, WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTROT, and WTRSKL.

name: Reason for attending training: acquire further skills/knowledge
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTRSKL indicates whether the respondent had attended the training in order to improve knowledge or skills relevant to the respondent's current occupational field.  Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHG, WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTROT, and WTRPERS.

name: Area of work-related training: general professional training
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related training, WTAPRF indicates whether the respondent had attended a general profession training workshop or seminar.  Other variables indicating the type of training a respondent might have taken include WTMGT, WTOT, and WTTECH.

name: Area of work-related training: management training
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related training, WTMGT indicates whether the respondent had attended a management training workshop or seminar.  Other variables indicating the type of training a respondent might have taken include WTAPRF, WTOT, and WTTECH.

name: Area of work-related training: other
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related training, WTOT indicates whether the respondent had attended a training that focused on a different topic than management, general professional, or technical training in the respondent's occupational field (which were the only survey responses).  Other variables indicating the type of training a respondent might have taken include WTAPRF, WTMGT, and WTTECH.

name: Area of work-related training: technical training
description: If a respondent had attended a work-related training, WTTECH indicates whether the respondent had attended a technical training in the respondent's occupational field.  Other variables indicating the type of training a respondent might have taken include WTAPRF, WTMGT, and WTOT.

name: Licensed/certified in occupation
description: OCLIC indicates whether or not the respondent was licensed and/or certified in his/her occupation.

name: Job required technical expertise: natural sciences
description: MGRNAT indicates whether or not the respondent's principal job requires technical expertise at least at the bachelor's degree level in engineering, computer science, math, or natural sciences.  The variables MGRSOC and MGROTH indicate expertise requirements in social sciences or other fields, respectively.

name: Job required technical expertise: other
description: MGROTH indicates whether or not the respondent's principal job requires technical expertise at least at the bachelor's degree level in a field other than the natural or social sciences.  The variables MGRNAT and MGRSOC indicate expertise requirements in natural sciences or social sciences, respectively.

name: Job required technical expertise: social sciences
description: MGRNAT indicates whether or not the respondent's principal job requires technical expertise at least at the bachelor's degree level in social sciences.  The variables MGROTH and MGRNAT indicate expertise requirements in other fields or natural sciences, respectively.

name: Technical expertise required by spouse/partner job: sciences
description: SPNAT indicates whether or not the job of the respondent's spouse required the spouse to have technical expertise in engineering, computer science, math, or natural sciences at the bachelor degree level or higher.  Related variables include SPOT and SPSOC.

name: Technical expertise required by spouse/partner job: other
description: SPOT indicates whether or not the job of the respondent's spouse required the spouse to have technical expertise in a field other than natural or social sciences at the bachelor degree level or higher.  Related variables include SPNAT and SPSOC.

name: Technical expertise required by spouse/partner Job: social sciences
description: SPSOC indicates whether or not the job of the respondent's spouse required the spouse to have technical expertise in social sciences at the bachelor degree level or higher.  Related variables include SPNAT and SPOT.

name: Job code for last job (major group)
description: NOCMLST categorizes the respondent's last job into seven broad fields. The variable OCLSTPB provides this information with a finer level of detail.

name: Job code for last job (public use)
description: OCLSTP gives a detailed occupation code for the respondent's previous occupation.  NOCMLST is an aggregated version of this variable.

name: Reason for changing employer or job: change in career/professional interests
description: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHCHG reports whether or not a change in professional or career interests was a reason for that change.  Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCON, CHFAM, CHLAY, CHLOC, CHOT, CHPAY, CHRET, and CHSCH.

name: Reason for changing employer or job: working conditions
description: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHCON reports whether or not working conditions were a reason for that change.  Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHFAM, CHLAY, CHLOC, CHOT, CHPAY, CHRET, and CHSCH.

name: Reason for changing employer or job: family-related reasons
description: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHFAM reports whether family-related reasons were among the reasons for that change.  Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHCON, CHLAY, CHLOC, CHOT, CHPAY, CHRET, and CHSCH.

name: Reason for changing employer or job: laid off/job terminated
description: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHLAY reports whether being laid off or having his/her job terminated was a reason for that change.  Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHCON, CHFAM, CHLOC, CHOT, CHPAY, CHRET, and CHSCH.

name: Reason for changing employer or job: job location
description: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHLOC reports whether or not the job's location was a reason for that change.  Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHCON, CHFAM, CHLAY, CHOT, CHPAY, CHRET, and CHSCH.

name: Reason for changing employer or job: other
description: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHOT indicates that there was a reason for the change in employment other than the reasons listed as options on the questionnaire.  Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHCON, CHFAM, CHLAY, CHLOC, CHPAY, CHRET, and CHSCH.

name: Reason for changing employer or job: pay, promotion
description: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHPAY reports whether or not pay or promotion opportunities were a reason for that change.  Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHCON, CHFAM, CHLAY, CHLOC, CHOT, CHRET, and CHSCH.

name: Reason for changing employer or job: retired
description: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHRET reports whether or not the respondent's retirement was a reason for that change.  Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHCON, CHFAM, CHLAY, CHLOC, CHOT, CHPAY, and CHSCH.

name: Reason for changing employer or job: school-related reasons
description: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHSCH reports whether or not school-related reasons were a reason for that change.  Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHCON, CHFAM, CHLAY, CHLOC, CHOT, CHPAY, and CHRET.

name: Offered buy-out
description: BUYOUT reports whether or not the respondent had ever been offered a buyout, or early retirement in exchange for a cash settlement, by an employer.  If yes, the respondent also answered if they accepted the offer or not.

name: Job code for principal job in 1988 (major group)
description: For respondents who were working in April 1988 (5 years prior to the survey), OCOMG reports a broad occupation code for the principal job of the respondent at that time.  OCO is a more detailed version of this variable.

name: Job code for principal job in 1988
description: For respondents who were working in April 1988 (5 years prior to the survey), OCO reports a detailed occupation code for the principal job of the respondent at that time.   OCOMG are aggregated versions of this variable into major occupation groups.

name: International collaboration indicator
description: ICOLLAB indicates whether or not a respondent collaborated with other researchers outside of the United States.

name: International collaboration activity: communicate by phone/email
description: ICCOMM indicates whether or not a respondent collaborated with other researchers outside of the United States using phone and/or email.

name: International collaboration activity: travel abroad for collaboration
description: ICTRLA indicates whether or not a respondent collaborated with other researchers outside of the United States and the respondent traveled abroad for the collaboration.

name: International collaboration activity: foreign collaborators travel to US
description: ICTRLH indicates whether or not a respondent collaborated with other researchers outside of the United States by the international collaborators traveling to the US.

name: International collaboration activity: use web-based/virtual technology
description: ICWBVT indicates whether or not a respondent collaborated with other researchers outside of the United States using a web-based or virtual technology.

name: New job offered what level of: responsibility
description: For respondents who recently found new job, the variable NEWRESP compares the level of responsibility given in his/her new job to the level of responsibility in his/her previous job. Related variables include NEWSAL and NEWSKILL.

name: New job offered what level of: salary
description: For respondents who recently found new job, the variable NEWRESP compares the salary in his/her new job to the salary in his/her previous job. Related variables include NEWRESP and NEWSKILL.

name: New job offered what level of: knowledge/skill utilization
description: For respondents who recently found new job, the variable NEWRESP compares the level of knowledge or skill utilization required in his/her new job to the knowledge or skill utilization required in his/her previous job. Related variables include NEWRESP and NEWSAL.

name: Reasons for not working: family responsibilities
description: NWFAM indicates whether or not the respondent's family responsibilities were one reason for the respondent not working during the reference week. Other variables from this survey question include NWILL, NWLAY, NWNOND, NWOCNA, NWOTP, NWRET, NWSTU and NWOT.

name: Reasons for not working: illness/disability
description: NWILL indicates whether or not illness or disability was one reason for the respondent not working during the reference week. Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, NWLAY, NWNOND, NWOCNA, NWOTP, NWRET, NWSTU and NWOT.

name: Reasons for not working: layoff
description: NWLAY indicates whether or not being laid off from a previous job was one reason for not working during the reference week. Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, NWILL, NWNOND, NWOCNA, NWOTP, NWRET, NWSTU and NWOT.

name: Reasons for not working: did not need/want to work
description: NWNOND indicates whether or not that the respondent was not working during the reference week because he/she did not need or want to work. Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, NWILL, NWLAY, NWOCNA, NWOTP, NWRET, NWSTU and NWOT.

name: Reasons for not working: suitable job not available
description: NWOCNA indicates whether or not the respondent was not working during the reference week because a suitable job not available. Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, NWILL, NWLAY, NWNOND, NWOTP, NWRET, NWSTU and NWOT.

name: Reasons for not working: other
description: NWOT indicates whether or not the respondent was not working during the reference week for a reason other than the ones listed in the questionnaire. From 2003-2010 (and S-NSCG 2013), three response options (Illness, Retired and Other) were combined in the SESTAT version of the surveys, see NWOTP.  Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, NWILL, NWLAY, NWNOND, NWRET, NWOCNA and NWSTU.

name: Reasons for not working: illness, retired or other (combined)
description: NWOTP indicates whether or not illness, retirement or some other reason were causes for not working. This variable combines three response options into one variable (Illness, Retired and Other). In years prior to 2003 (and the 2013 S-SDR), these response options are not combined, see NWILL, NWOT and NWRET.  Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, , NWLAY, NWNOND, , NWOCNA, and NWSTU.

name: Reasons for not working: retired
description: NWRET indicates whether or not that the respondent being retired was one reason for not working during the reference week. Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, NWILL, NWLAY, NWNOND, NWOTP, NWOCNA, NWSTU and NWOT.

name: Reasons for not working: student
description: NWSTU indicates whether or not that the respondent was student was one reason for not working during the reference week. Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, NWILL, NWLAY, NWNOND, NWRET, NWOCNA, NWOTP and NWOT.

name: Concerned about someone else in household losing job
description: HHLOSE indicates the extent to which the respondent was concerned about another adult in the household losing his/her job.  The question explicitly excludes the respondent's concern about his/her own job security.

name: No other working adult in household
description: HHLOSENO indicates whether or not another adult in the respondent's household was working at the time of the survey.  Users should note that the response No means that another adult was working in the household, and Yes means that no other adult in the household was working during the reference period.
